.NET Framework 3.5.name: VRTK_RadialMenu
.NET Framework 3.5.summary: This adds a UI element into the world space that can be dropped into a Controller object and used to create and use Radial Menus from the touchpad.
.NET Framework 3.5.remarks:
If the RadialMenu is placed inside a controller, it will automatically find a VRTK_ControllerEvents in its parent to use at the input. However, a VRTK_ControllerEvents can be defined explicitly by setting the Events parameter of the Radial Menu Controller script also attached to the prefab.

 The RadialMenu can also be placed inside a `VRTK_InteractableObject` for the RadialMenu to be anchored to a world object instead of the controller. The `Events Manager` parameter will automatically be set if the RadialMenu is a child of an InteractableObject, but it can also be set manually in the inspector. Additionally, for the RadialMenu to be anchored in the world, the `RadialMenuController` script in the prefab must be replaced with `VRTK_IndependentRadialMenuController`. See the script information for further details on making the RadialMenu independent of the controllers.
.NET Framework 3.5.example: VRTK/Examples/030_Controls_RadialTouchpadMenu displays a radial menu for each controller. The left controller uses the Hide On Release variable, so it will only be visible if the left touchpad is being touched. It also uses the Execute On Unclick variable to delay execution until the touchpad button is unclicked. The example scene also contains a demonstration of anchoring the RadialMenu to an interactable cube instead of a controller.

methods.name: AddButton(RadialMenuButton newButton)
methods.summary: The AddButton method is used to add a new button to the menu.

methods.name: ClickButton(float angle)
methods.summary: The ClickButton method is used to set the button click at a given angle.

methods.name: GetButton(int id)
methods.summary: The GetButton method is used to get a button from the menu.

params.value: The id of the button to retrieve.

methods.name: HideMenu(bool force)
methods.summary: The HideMenu method is used to hide the menu.

params.value: If true then the menu is always hidden.

methods.name: HoverButton(float angle)
methods.summary: The HoverButton method is used to set the button hover at a given angle.

methods.name: InteractButton(float angle, ButtonEvent evt)
methods.syntax: protected virtual void InteractButton(float angle, ButtonEvent evt)
methods.linkedSyntax: protected virtual void InteractButton(float angle, ButtonEvent evt)

methods.name: RegenerateButtons()
methods.summary: The RegenerateButtons method creates all the button arcs and populates them with desired icons.

methods.name: ShowMenu()
methods.summary: The ShowMenu method is used to show the menu.

methods.name: StopTouching()
methods.summary: The StopTouching method is used to stop touching the menu.

methods.name: ToggleMenu()
methods.summary: The ToggleMenu method is used to show or hide the radial menu.

methods.name: UnClickButton(float angle)
methods.summary: The UnClickButton method is used to set the button unclick at a given angle.
